examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Short hair really becomes you.
The child will become an adult.
The new office block has become an expensive white elephant.
The old government program has become a sacred cow.
words.defineEn: to start or grow to be
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc phát triển để được

examples: Rooms begin at $139.
A new era had begun.
The lecture begins at 8pm.
Each chapter begins with a quotation.
We began work on the project in May.
words.defineEn: to do or experience the first part of something
words.defineVi: để làm hoặc trải nghiệm phần đầu tiên của một cái gì đó

examples: My grandparents have been married for over forty years.
David's uncle married money when he wed a rich woman who owned a big company.
Nicholas and his better half, Rachel, have been happily married for over 20 years.
They were very unhappily married but kept up appearances for the sake of their children.
Many people choose not to marry.
words.defineEn: to become someone's husband or wife
words.defineVi: trở thành vợ hoặc chồng của ai đó

examples: The days passed slowly.
The time passed quickly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The feeling of sickness soon passed.
Unemployment has now passed the three million mark.
words.defineEn: to approach a specific place, object, or person and move past them
words.defineVi: để tiếp cận một địa điểm cụ thể, đối tượng, hoặc người và di chuyển qua chúng

examples: Cable TV reaches a huge audience.
Daytime temperatures can reach 40°C.
The problem has now reached crisis point.
This tree can reach a height of 24 metres.
Her popularity reached its peak in the late 1990s.
words.defineEn: to come to a certain level or state, or a specific point in time
words.defineVi: đạt đến một mức độ hoặc trạng thái nhất định, hoặc một thời điểm cụ thể

examples: to return a greeting.
Please return the completed form at your earliest convenience.
I am returned.
He did not return her love.
The stock market rally resulted in a fat return on investment for many investors.
words.defineEn: to go or come back to a person, place, or state
words.defineVi: để đi hoặc trở lại với một người, địa điểm, hoặc tiểu bang

examples: listen to our problems.
Listen Jane.
I listened carefully to her story.
Don’t listen to Jerry.
Don't listen to him.
words.defineEn: to give our attention to the sound a person or thing is making
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho sự chú ý của chúng tôi đến âm thanh một người hoặc điều đang làm

examples: Others were reunited with their families in Saudi Arabia.
We will reunite all of the families.
That reunited Gargano and Scontrone with the rest of the mainland, where they remain today.
So far, 45 percent of those children have been confirmed reunited.
A chance New York City encounter reunites one of our correspondents with an asylum seeker she met on one of the world's most dangerous migration routes.
words.defineEn: to bring together again, especially after a period of separation
words.defineVi: tập hợp lại với nhau, đặc biệt là sau một thời gian xa cách

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to hold, possess, or own an object or a quality
words.defineVi: để giữ, sở hữu, hoặc sở hữu một đối tượng hoặc một chất lượng

examples: The food looks good.
Good wine can make a meal.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
This information is as good as gold.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is satisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng thỏa mãn

examples: Every relationship has a lot of ups and downs.
The siblings' relationship was a cat-and-dog life.
A stable relationship stands the test of time.
Evidence of their relationship exists in the form of a series of letters.
It puts a damper on our relationship.
words.defineEn: the connection among two or more things or people or the way in which they are connected
words.defineVi: sự kết nối giữa hai hoặc nhiều thứ hoặc con người hoặc cách thức mà chúng được kết nối

examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to mentally grasp something or someone's words or actions
words.defineVi: để nắm bắt tinh thần một cái gì đó hoặc lời nói hoặc hành động của ai đó

words.defineEn: to legally become someone's wife or husband
words.defineVi: để hợp pháp trở thành vợ hoặc chồng của một ai đó

examples: Don't worry, I'm not getting back together with Alex.
We made a pit stop for some food before getting back on the highway.
OK, let's get back on the road.
Give me a call when you get back from your trip.
He went at it hammer and tongs as soon as he got back from work.
words.defineEn: to return to a place
words.defineVi: trở về một nơi

words.defineEn: to overcome or move beyond a difficult or challenging situation, obstacle, or emotional state
words.defineVi: để vượt qua hoặc vượt qua một tình huống khó khăn hoặc thử thách, trở ngại hoặc trạng thái cảm xúc

examples: Or a big family get together?
After the action in the ring, Clay and three famous friends get together in a motel room for the real action, deeply personal debates over their work and responsibilities as Black men.
Maybe get together.
Back in 2017, the three credit bureaus, the major ones, Experian, Equifax and TransUnion, and they got together
Everybody gets together?
words.defineEn: to meet with a person in order to cooperate or socialize
words.defineVi: để gặp gỡ với một người để hợp tác hoặc giao lưu

words.defineEn: to cause someone to feel frustrated, angry, or upset, often by persistently behaving in a way that provokes or aggravates them
words.defineVi: để khiến ai đó cảm thấy thất vọng, tức giận hoặc khó chịu, thường bằng cách liên tục cư xử theo cách khiêu khích hoặc làm trầm trọng thêm họ

words.defineEn: to begin or initiate a particular task, activity, or process
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc bắt đầu một nhiệm vụ cụ thể, hoạt động, hoặc quá trình

examples: We got at first a trickle of people.
You can get at the battery.
You can get at the storage.
What are you getting at, here?
That you can like get at the Indian restaurants.
words.defineEn: to cause irritation or annoyance to someone
words.defineVi: để gây khó chịu hoặc khó chịu cho một ai đó

examples: I can't believe he got away with cheating on his taxes again.
I held the attacker at bay while Mary got away and called the police.
Hey, get away!
You get away quickly.
Could any other company get away with selling a brick or a branded crowbar?
words.defineEn: to escape from someone or somewhere
words.defineVi: để thoát khỏi một ai đó hoặc một nơi nào đó

examples: She got into the car.
The town itself has got into gear with a campaign to improve the environment.
Little kids get into everything, and it can really try your patience.
They got into trouble with the law for driving under the influence.
She got into trouble with her parents for staying out too late on school nights.
words.defineEn: to begin participating in, learning about, and developing a strong interest or passion for a particular activity, hobby, or topic
words.defineVi: bắt đầu tham gia, tìm hiểu và phát triển mối quan tâm hoặc đam mê mạnh mẽ đối với một hoạt động, sở thích hoặc chủ đề cụ thể

examples: Melissa's new book got off to a flying start, with high sales and positive reviews from readers and critics alike.
Do me a favour and get off my back!
The concert tour didn't get off the ground until the band's new album was released and started gaining popularity.
The bus ground to a halt at the corner and someone got off.
It took a lot of hard work, but their business finally got off the ground.
words.defineEn: to leave a bus, train, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một chiếc xe buýt, xe lửa, máy bay, vv

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.
They got on bad terms after an argument.
Don't get on your high horse with me.
words.defineEn: to enter a bus, ship, airplane, etc.
words.defineVi: để vào xe buýt, tàu, máy bay, v.v.

examples: Get out!
Word got out about the surprise party, and it wasn't a surprise anymore.
A car drives up, and a man gets out.
A car drove up to us and a man got out.
A fool may throw a stone into a well which a hundred wise men cannot get out.
words.defineEn: to leave somewhere such as a room, building, etc.
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một nơi nào đó chẳng hạn như một căn phòng, tòa nhà, vv

examples: In our lectures we need to get over the importance of online safety.
Still can't get over the idea that someone thought bullying real life children was an acceptable thing to do.
He reminded himself that he that stays in the valley will not get over the hill, and enrolled in advanced classes.
The company must stop shooting itself in the foot if it wants to get over its troubles.
I can’t get over how well you look.
words.defineEn: to recover from an unpleasant or unhappy experience, particularly an illness
words.defineVi: để phục hồi từ một trải nghiệm khó chịu hoặc không vui, đặc biệt là một căn bệnh

words.defineEn: to find a way to deal with or overcome a problem or obstacle
words.defineVi: để tìm cách giải quyết hoặc vượt qua một vấn đề hoặc trở ngại

examples: I got through school by the seat of my pants.
You're not getting through here with me standing.
It seems like every time I'm in a rush to catch a flight, the security line is extra long, and I always get stuck behind someone who's taking forever to get through.
Get through the skin.
They got through everything.
words.defineEn: to succeed in passing a difficult experience or period
words.defineVi: để thành công trong việc vượt qua một kinh nghiệm khó khăn hoặc giai đoạn

examples: It really gets up my nose.
He's just getting up my nose so much at the moment.
He got up on the wrong side of the bed this morning.
You, the night owl, are getting up at 5 AM tomorrow?
I got up and looked out of the window.
words.defineEn: to get on our feet and stand up
words.defineVi: để có được trên đôi chân của chúng tôi và đứng lên

words.defineEn: be used to draw attention to something that the speaker considers important or interesting
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thu hút sự chú ý đến một cái gì đó mà người nói coi là quan trọng hoặc thú vị
